intro: Sarcocephalus esculentus var. amarissima, commonly known as the bitter wild bean, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant produces elongated, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. While the fruit is edible, it has a distinct bitter taste, which is why it is often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and ethnobotanical practices.
